column5: http://video.google.ca/videoplay?docid=-53...yne+and+shuster.  This was 47 years ago,  but the writing and the satire are still up to date from John and Frank, in true Canadian style.  Some nice live stuff from Al Hirt's Orlean's trumpet (Wynton, eatcha heart out) and the ever classy, classic Dinah Shore.

Dat was the first woman I ever fell in love with and she had to pick up Burt Reynolds. I reckon her eyesight and judgment went on her.......  Al Hirt was the best at the time...in later years, he developped a few problems....we all do.
Wynton Marsellus is still one good jazz man.  And as far as Dinah....I was ready to convert if she would have had me even though I was pre puberty.   I really wanted to see the USA in HER Chevrolet!
